page.title: 17A SCHOOL FLOCK
page.content: Kingstone High School has kept a flock of sheep since 1975 when land adjacent to the school was purchased for this purpose. Prior to this the school had become involved in organising breed trails for the Ryeland Flock Book Society using the home farms of pupils. The scheme itself together with the many resulting educational offshoots attracted the attention of a large number of other similar establishments in this country and abroad. Supreme awards have been won at major shows by both the school and individual pupils in OPEN competition. The scheme has attracted the interest and active participation of parents, with the press both local and national always ready to report any new developments involving the school flock or its young shepherds.
